results.title: Attenuation by atenolol of myocardial acidosis during ischemia in dogs: contribution of beta-1 adrenoceptors to myocardial acidosis.
results.text_hl: Attenuation by @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ of @<m>DISEASE_Acidosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000138 @@@myocardial acidosis@@@ during @DISEASE_Ischemia @DISEASE_MESH:D007511 @@@ischemia@@@ in @SPECIES_9615 @@@dogs@@@: contribution of beta-1 adrenoceptors to @<m>DISEASE_Acidosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000138 @@@myocardial acidosis@@@.

citations.NLM: Sakai K, Abiko Y. Attenuation by atenolol of myocardial acidosis during ischemia in dogs: contribution of beta-1 adrenoceptors to myocardial acidosis. J Pharmacol Exp Ther. 1985 Mar;232(3):810-6. PMID: 2857788
citations.BibTeX: @article{2857788, title={Attenuation by atenolol of myocardial acidosis during ischemia in dogs: contribution of beta-1 adrenoceptors to myocardial acidosis.}, author={Sakai K and Abiko Y}, journal={J Pharmacol Exp Ther}, volume={232}, number={3}, pages={810-6}}

results.title: Bopindolol and its metabolite 18-502 attenuate regional myocardial acidosis during partial occlusion of the coronary artery in dogs.
results.text_hl: These results suggest that both @CHEMICAL_bopindolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:C036007 @@@bopindolol@@@ and 18-502 attenuate the @DISEASE_Ischemia @DISEASE_MESH:D007511 @@@ischemia@@@-induced regional @<m>DISEASE_Acidosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000138 @@@acidosis of@@@ the myocardium as does @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, and, hence, have an anti-@DISEASE_Brain_Ischemia @DISEASE_MESH:D002545 @@@ischemic@@@ action.

citations.NLM: Abiko Y, Gotoh H, Yokoyama T, Abiko T, Hashizume H, Akiyama K. Bopindolol and its metabolite 18-502 attenuate regional myocardial acidosis during partial occlusion of the coronary artery in dogs. Arch Int Pharmacodyn Ther. 1994 Jan-Feb;327(1):40-55. PMID: 7944827
citations.BibTeX: @article{7944827, title={Bopindolol and its metabolite 18-502 attenuate regional myocardial acidosis during partial occlusion of the coronary artery in dogs.}, author={Abiko Y and Gotoh H and Yokoyama T and Abiko T and Hashizume H and Akiyama K}, journal={Arch Int Pharmacodyn Ther}, volume={327}, number={1}, pages={40-55}}

results.title: Comparative study of the effects of acebutolol, atenolol, d-propranolol and dl,-propranolol on the alterations in energy metabolism caused by ischemia and reperfusion: a 31P NMR study on the isolated rat heart.
results.text_hl: During @DISEASE_Ischemia @DISEASE_MESH:D007511 @@@ischemia@@@: intracellular @<m>DISEASE_Acidosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000138 @@@acidosis@@@, @CHEMICAL_Adenosine_Triphosphate @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000255 @@@adenosine triphosphate@@@ (@CHEMICAL_Adenosine_Triphosphate @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000255 @@@ATP@@@) degradation, and @CHEMICAL_Phosphates @CHEMICAL_MESH:D010710 @@@inorganic phosphate@@@ (Pi) accumulation were found to be reduced whether the perfusion fluid contained: @CHEMICAL_Acebutolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000070 @@@acebutolol@@@ 2.7 x 10(-5) M, @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ 10(-5) M, d-propranolol 10(-5) M, or @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@dl-propranolol@@@ 10(-5) M.

citations.NLM: Lavanchy N, Martin J, Rossi A. Comparative study of the effects of acebutolol, atenolol, d-propranolol and dl,-propranolol on the alterations in energy metabolism caused by ischemia and reperfusion: a 31P NMR study on the isolated rat heart. Cardiovasc Drugs Ther. 1988 Nov;2(4):501-12. PMID: 2908708
citations.BibTeX: @article{2908708, title={Comparative study of the effects of acebutolol, atenolol, d-propranolol and dl,-propranolol on the alterations in energy metabolism caused by ischemia and reperfusion: a 31P NMR study on the isolated rat heart.}, author={Lavanchy N and Martin J and Rossi A}, journal={Cardiovasc Drugs Ther}, volume={2}, number={4}, pages={501-12}}

results.title: Insulin-glucose as adjunctive therapy for severe calcium channel antagonist poisoning.
results.text_hl: All subjects had hypodynamic @DISEASE_Shock @DISEASE_MESH:D012769 @@@circulatory shock@@@ (@DISEASE_Hypotension @DISEASE_MESH:D007022 @@@hypotension@@@, @DISEASE_Bradycardia @DISEASE_MESH:D001919 @@@bradycardia@@@, and @<m>DISEASE_Acidosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000138 @@@acidosis@@@) that was not adequately responsive to conventional treatment.

citations.NLM: Yuan TH, Kerns WP 2nd, Tomaszewski CA, Ford MD, Kline JA. Insulin-glucose as adjunctive therapy for severe calcium channel antagonist poisoning. J Toxicol Clin Toxicol. 1999;37(4):463-74. PMID: 10465243
citations.BibTeX: @article{10465243, title={Insulin-glucose as adjunctive therapy for severe calcium channel antagonist poisoning.}, author={Yuan TH and Kerns WP 2nd and Tomaszewski CA and Ford MD and Kline JA}, journal={J Toxicol Clin Toxicol}, volume={37}, number={4}, pages={463-74}}

results.title: Beta 1 adrenoceptor mediated decrease in pHi in quiescent ventricular myocardium.
results.text_hl: The @CHEMICAL_Isoproterenol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007545 @@@isoprenaline@@@ induced @<m>DISEASE_Acidosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000138 @@@intracellular acidosis@@@ was blocked by the beta 1 blocker @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (10 microM) but not by the beta 2 blocker @CHEMICAL_ICI_118551 @CHEMICAL_MESH:C026777 @@@ICI 118,551@@@ (0.1 microM).

citations.NLM: Shida S, Nakaya H, Matsumoto S, Kanno M. Beta 1 adrenoceptor mediated decrease in pHi in quiescent ventricular myocardium. Cardiovasc Res. 1994 Jan;28(1):112-8. PMID: 7906613
citations.BibTeX: @article{7906613, title={Beta 1 adrenoceptor mediated decrease in pHi in quiescent ventricular myocardium.}, author={Shida S and Nakaya H and Matsumoto S and Kanno M}, journal={Cardiovasc Res}, volume={28}, number={1}, pages={112-8}}

results.title: Hyperkalemia due to hyporeninemic hypoaldosteronism with liver cirrhosis and hypertension.
results.text_hl: A 49-year-old man with @DISEASE_Liver_Cirrhosis @DISEASE_MESH:D008103 @@@liver cirrhosis@@@ and @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ was found to have @DISEASE_Hyperkalemia @DISEASE_MESH:D006947 @@@hyperkalemia@@@ out of a degree of @DISEASE_Renal_Insufficiency @DISEASE_MESH:D051437 @@@renal insufficiency@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Acidosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000138 @@@metabolic acidosis@@@ with low to normal anion gap, aggravated by @DISEASE_Crisponi_syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:C536214 @@@volume contraction@@@ with @DISEASE_Diarrhea @DISEASE_MESH:D003967 @@@diarrhea@@@ and medications (@CHEMICAL_Captopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002216 @@@captopril@@@, @CHEMICAL_Spironolactone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013148 @@@spironolactone@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@) interfering with @CHEMICAL_Potassium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011188 @@@potassium@@@ homeostasis.

citations.NLM: Kee CS, Choi JW, Chang DK, Ahn YH, Kim HJ. Hyperkalemia due to hyporeninemic hypoaldosteronism with liver cirrhosis and hypertension. J Korean Med Sci. 1993 Dec;8(6):464-70. PMID: 8179835
citations.BibTeX: @article{8179835, title={Hyperkalemia due to hyporeninemic hypoaldosteronism with liver cirrhosis and hypertension.}, author={Kee CS and Choi JW and Chang DK and Ahn YH and Kim HJ}, journal={J Korean Med Sci}, volume={8}, number={6}, pages={464-70}}
